trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs for Xamarin.Android apps | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs for Xamarin.Android apps | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin Android application.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you learn how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin Android application.

trans-unit.source: Get started with Notification Hubs
trans-unit.target: Get started with Notification Hubs

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin.Android application.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use Azure Notification Hubs to send push notifications to a Xamarin.Android application.

trans-unit.source: You'll create a blank Xamarin.Android app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).
trans-unit.target: You'll create a blank Xamarin.Android app that receives push notifications by using Google Cloud Messaging (GCM).

trans-unit.source: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.
trans-unit.target: When you're finished, you'll be able to use your notification hub to broadcast push notifications to all the devices running your app.

trans-unit.source: The finished code is available in the <link><linkText>NotificationHubs app[github]</linkText><title></title></link> sample.
trans-unit.target: The finished code is available in the <link><linkText>NotificationHubs app[github]</linkText><title></title></link> sample.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial demonstrates the simple broadcast scenario in using Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: [Xamarin.Android]
trans-unit.target: [Xamarin.Android]

trans-unit.source: Active Google account
trans-unit.target: Active Google account

trans-unit.source: [Azure Mobile Services Component]
trans-unit.target: [Azure Mobile Services Component]

trans-unit.source: [Azure Messaging Component]
trans-unit.target: [Azure Messaging Component]

trans-unit.source: [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component]
trans-unit.target: [Google Cloud Messaging Client Component]

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Xamarin.Android apps.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial is a prerequisite for all other Notification Hubs tutorials for Xamarin.Android apps.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link><linkText>Azure Free Trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Configure your notification hub
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Configure your notification hub

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Connect your app to the notification hub
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Connect your app to the notification hub

trans-unit.source: Create a new project
trans-unit.target: Create a new project

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio (or Visual Studio), click File and New, click Android Application in the New Solution dialog, and finally click OK.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio (or Visual Studio), click File and New, click Android Application in the New Solution dialog, and finally click OK.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new Android project.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new Android project.

trans-unit.source: Open the project properties by right-clicking your new project in the Solution view and choosing Options.
trans-unit.target: Open the project properties by right-clicking your new project in the Solution view and choosing Options.

trans-unit.source: Select the Android Application item in the Build section.
trans-unit.target: Select the Android Application item in the Build section.

trans-unit.source: Set the Minimum Android version to API Level 8.
trans-unit.target: Set the Minimum Android version to API Level 8.

trans-unit.source: Set the Target Android version to the API version that you want to target (must be API level 8 or higher).
trans-unit.target: Set the Target Android version to the API version that you want to target (must be API level 8 or higher).

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the first letter of your Package name is lowercase.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the first letter of your Package name is lowercase.

trans-unit.source: The first letter of the package name must be lowercase.
trans-unit.target: The first letter of the package name must be lowercase.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you will receive application manifest errors when you register your BroadcastReceiver and IntentFilter for push notifications below.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you will receive application manifest errors when you register your BroadcastReceiver and IntentFilter for push notifications below.

trans-unit.source: Add the required components to your project
trans-unit.target: Add the required components to your project

trans-unit.source: The Google Cloud Messaging Client available on the Xamarin Component Store simplifies the process of supporting push notifications in Xamarin.Android.
trans-unit.target: The Google Cloud Messaging Client available on the Xamarin Component Store simplifies the process of supporting push notifications in Xamarin.Android.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Components folder in Xamarin.Android app and choose Get More Components.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Components folder in Xamarin.Android app and choose Get More Components.

trans-unit.source: Search for the Azure Messaging component and add it to the project.
trans-unit.target: Search for the Azure Messaging component and add it to the project.

trans-unit.source: Search for the Google Cloud Messaging Client component and add it to the project.
trans-unit.target: Search for the Google Cloud Messaging Client component and add it to the project.

trans-unit.source: Set up notification hubs in your project
trans-unit.target: Set up notification hubs in your project

trans-unit.source: Gather the following information for your Android app and notification hub:
trans-unit.target: Gather the following information for your Android app and notification hub:

trans-unit.source: GoogleProjectNumber: Get this Project Number value from the overview of your app on the Google Developer Portal.
trans-unit.target: GoogleProjectNumber: Get this Project Number value from the overview of your app on the Google Developer Portal.

trans-unit.source: You made a note of this value earlier when you created the app on the portal.
trans-unit.target: You made a note of this value earlier when you created the app on the portal.

trans-unit.source: Listen connection string: On the dashboard in the Azure portal, click View connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Listen connection string: On the dashboard in the Azure portal, click View connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Copy the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature connection string for this value.
trans-unit.target: Copy the DefaultListenSharedAccessSignature connection string for this value.

trans-unit.source: Hub name: This is the name of your hub from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Hub name: This is the name of your hub from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: For example, mynotificationhub2.
trans-unit.target: For example, mynotificationhub2.

trans-unit.source: Create a Constants.cs class for your Xamarin project and define the following constant values in the class.
trans-unit.target: Create a Constants.cs class for your Xamarin project and define the following constant values in the class.

trans-unit.source: Replace the placeholders with your values.
trans-unit.target: Replace the placeholders with your values.

trans-unit.source: public const string SenderID = "<html></html>"; // Google API Project Number
trans-unit.target: public const string SenderID = "<html></html>"; // Google API Project Number

trans-unit.source: public const string ListenConnectionString = "<html></html>";
trans-unit.target: public const string ListenConnectionString = "<html></html>";

trans-unit.source: public const string NotificationHubName = "<html></html>";
trans-unit.target: public const string NotificationHubName = "<html></html>";

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to MainActivity.cs:
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to MainActivity.cs:

trans-unit.source: Add an instance variable to the MainActivity class that will be used to show an alert dialog when the app is running:
trans-unit.target: Add an instance variable to the MainActivity class that will be used to show an alert dialog when the app is running:

trans-unit.source: Create the following method in the MainActivity class:
trans-unit.target: Create the following method in the MainActivity class:

trans-unit.source: Add a call to RegisterWithGCM in the OnCreate method of MainActivity.cs:
trans-unit.target: Add a call to RegisterWithGCM in the OnCreate method of MainActivity.cs:

trans-unit.source: Create a new class, MyBroadcastReceiver.
trans-unit.target: Create a new class, MyBroadcastReceiver.

trans-unit.source: We will walk through creating a BroadcastReceiver class from scratch below.
trans-unit.target: We will walk through creating a BroadcastReceiver class from scratch below.

trans-unit.source: However, a quick alternative to manually creating MyBroadcastReceiver.cs is to refer to the GcmService.cs file found in the sample Xamarin.Android project included with the NotificationHubs samples[github].
trans-unit.target: However, a quick alternative to manually creating MyBroadcastReceiver.cs is to refer to the GcmService.cs file found in the sample Xamarin.Android project included with the NotificationHubs samples[github].

trans-unit.source: Duplicating GcmService.cs and changing class names can be a great place to start as well.
trans-unit.target: Duplicating GcmService.cs and changing class names can be a great place to start as well.

trans-unit.source: Add the following using statements to MyBroadcastReceiver.cs (referring to the component and assembly that you added earlier):
trans-unit.target: Add the following using statements to MyBroadcastReceiver.cs (referring to the component and assembly that you added earlier):

trans-unit.source: Add the following permission requests between the using statements and the namespace declaration:
trans-unit.target: Add the following permission requests between the using statements and the namespace declaration:

trans-unit.source: In MyBroadcastReceiver.cs, change the MyBroadcastReceiver class to match the following:
trans-unit.target: In MyBroadcastReceiver.cs, change the MyBroadcastReceiver class to match the following:

trans-unit.source: Add another class in MyBroadcastReceiver.cs named PushHandlerService, which derives from GcmServiceBase.
trans-unit.target: Add another class in MyBroadcastReceiver.cs named PushHandlerService, which derives from GcmServiceBase.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to apply the Service attribute to the class:
trans-unit.target: Make sure to apply the Service attribute to the class:

trans-unit.source: GcmServiceBase implements methods OnRegistered(), OnUnRegistered(), OnMessage(), OnRecoverableError(), and OnError().
trans-unit.target: GcmServiceBase implements methods OnRegistered(), OnUnRegistered(), OnMessage(), OnRecoverableError(), and OnError().

trans-unit.source: Our implementation class PushHandlerService must override these methods, and these methods will fire in response to interacting with the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: Our implementation class PushHandlerService must override these methods, and these methods will fire in response to interacting with the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Override the OnRegistered() method in PushHandlerService by using the following code:
trans-unit.target: Override the OnRegistered() method in PushHandlerService by using the following code:

trans-unit.source: In the OnRegistered() code above, you should note the ability to specify tags to register for specific messaging channels.
trans-unit.target: In the OnRegistered() code above, you should note the ability to specify tags to register for specific messaging channels.

trans-unit.source: Override the OnMessage method in PushHandlerService by using the following code:
trans-unit.target: Override the OnMessage method in PushHandlerService by using the following code:

trans-unit.source: Add the following createNotification and dialogNotify methods to PushHandlerService for notifying users when a notification is received.
trans-unit.target: Add the following createNotification and dialogNotify methods to PushHandlerService for notifying users when a notification is received.

trans-unit.source: Notification design in Android version 5.0 and later represents a significant departure from that of previous versions.
trans-unit.target: Notification design in Android version 5.0 and later represents a significant departure from that of previous versions.

trans-unit.source: If you test this on Android 5.0 or later, the app will need to be running to receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: If you test this on Android 5.0 or later, the app will need to be running to receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Android Notifications</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Android Notifications</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Override abstract members OnUnRegistered(), OnRecoverableError(), and OnError() so that your code compiles:
trans-unit.target: Override abstract members OnUnRegistered(), OnRecoverableError(), and OnError() so that your code compiles:

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Run your app in the emulator
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Run your app in the emulator

trans-unit.source: If you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.
trans-unit.target: If you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.

trans-unit.source: In order to receive push notifications, you must set up a Google account on your Android Virtual Device.
trans-unit.target: In order to receive push notifications, you must set up a Google account on your Android Virtual Device.

trans-unit.source: (In the emulator, navigate to Settings and click Add Account.)
trans-unit.target: (In the emulator, navigate to Settings and click Add Account.)

trans-unit.source: Also, make sure that the emulator is connected to the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Also, make sure that the emulator is connected to the Internet.

trans-unit.source: Notification design in Android version 5.0 and later represents a significant departure from that of previous versions.
trans-unit.target: Notification design in Android version 5.0 and later represents a significant departure from that of previous versions.

trans-unit.source: If you test this on Android 5.0 or later, the app will need to be running to receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: If you test this on Android 5.0 or later, the app will need to be running to receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Android Notifications</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Android Notifications</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: From Tools, click Open Android Emulator Manager, select your device, and then click Edit.
trans-unit.target: From Tools, click Open Android Emulator Manager, select your device, and then click Edit.

trans-unit.source: Select Google APIs in Target, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select Google APIs in Target, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: On the top toolbar, click Run, and then select your app.
trans-unit.target: On the top toolbar, click Run, and then select your app.

trans-unit.source: This starts the emulator and runs the app.
trans-unit.target: This starts the emulator and runs the app.

trans-unit.source: The app retrieves the registrationId from GCM and registers with the notification hub.
trans-unit.target: The app retrieves the registrationId from GCM and registers with the notification hub.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications from your backend
trans-unit.target: Send notifications from your backend

trans-unit.source: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.
trans-unit.target: You can test receiving notifications in your app by sending notifications in the Azure portal via the debug tab on the notification hub, as shown in the screen below.

trans-unit.source: Push notifications are normally sent in a backend service like Mobile Services or ASP.NET through a compatible library.
trans-unit.target: Push notifications are normally sent in a backend service like Mobile Services or ASP.NET through a compatible library.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the REST API directly to send notification messages if a library is not available for your backend.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the REST API directly to send notification messages if a library is not available for your backend.

trans-unit.source: Here is a list of some other tutorials that you may want to review for sending notifications:
trans-unit.target: Here is a list of some other tutorials that you may want to review for sending notifications:

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET: See [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET: See [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: Azure Notification Hubs Java SDK: See <link><linkText>How to use Notification Hubs from Java</linkText><title></title></link> for sending notifications from Java.
trans-unit.target: Azure Notification Hubs Java SDK: See <link><linkText>How to use Notification Hubs from Java</linkText><title></title></link> for sending notifications from Java.

trans-unit.source: This has been tested in Eclipse for Android Development.
trans-unit.target: This has been tested in Eclipse for Android Development.

trans-unit.source: PHP: See <link><linkText>How to use Notification Hubs from PHP</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: PHP: See <link><linkText>How to use Notification Hubs from PHP</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: In the next subsections of the tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console app, and by using a mobile service through a node script.
trans-unit.target: In the next subsections of the tutorial, you send notifications by using a .NET console app, and by using a mobile service through a node script.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications by using a .NET app
trans-unit.target: Send notifications by using a .NET app

trans-unit.source: Microsoft provides the Azure Service Bus SDK for sending notifications on the .NET platform.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft provides the Azure Service Bus SDK for sending notifications on the .NET platform.

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will create a .NET console application with Visual Studio to use the Azure Service Bus SDK to send a notification.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will create a .NET console application with Visual Studio to use the Azure Service Bus SDK to send a notification.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Visual C# console application:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Visual C# console application:

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package<html></html>.
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to the Azure Service Bus SDK by using the <html></html>WindowsAzure.ServiceBus NuGet package<html></html>.

trans-unit.source: In the Visual Studio main menu, click Tools, click Library Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.
trans-unit.target: In the Visual Studio main menu, click Tools, click Library Package Manager, and then click Package Manager Console.

trans-unit.source: Then, in the console window, type:
trans-unit.target: Then, in the console window, type:

trans-unit.source: and press Enter.
trans-unit.target: and press Enter.

trans-unit.source: Open the file Program.cs and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: Open the file Program.cs and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: In your Program class, add the following method.
trans-unit.target: In your Program class, add the following method.

trans-unit.source: Update the placeholder text with your DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string and hub name from the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: Update the placeholder text with your DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature connection string and hub name from the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Add the following lines in your Main method:
trans-unit.target: Add the following lines in your Main method:

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to run the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to run the app.

trans-unit.source: You should receive a notification in the app.
trans-unit.target: You should receive a notification in the app.

trans-unit.source: Send notifications by using a mobile service
trans-unit.target: Send notifications by using a mobile service

trans-unit.source: Follow [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: Follow [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and select your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal], and select your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Select the Scheduler tab on the top.
trans-unit.target: Select the Scheduler tab on the top.

trans-unit.source: Create a new scheduled job, insert a name, and select On demand.
trans-unit.target: Create a new scheduled job, insert a name, and select On demand.

trans-unit.source: When the job is created, click the job name.
trans-unit.target: When the job is created, click the job name.

trans-unit.source: Then click the Script tab on the top bar.
trans-unit.target: Then click the Script tab on the top bar.

trans-unit.source: Insert the following script inside your scheduler function.
trans-unit.target: Insert the following script inside your scheduler function.

trans-unit.source: Make sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.
trans-unit.target: Make sure to replace the placeholders with your notification hub name and the connection string for DefaultFullSharedAccessSignature that you obtained earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: Click Run Once on the bottom bar.
trans-unit.target: Click Run Once on the bottom bar.

trans-unit.source: You should receive a toast notification.
trans-unit.target: You should receive a toast notification.

trans-unit.source: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html> <html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your Android devices.
trans-unit.target: In this simple example, you broadcasted notifications to all your Android devices.

trans-unit.source: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: In order to target specific users, refer to the tutorial [Use Notification Hubs to push notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].
trans-unit.target: If you want to segment your users by interest groups, you can read [Use Notification Hubs to send breaking news].

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance] and in the [Notification Hubs How-To for Android].
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use Notification Hubs in [Notification Hubs Guidance] and in the [Notification Hubs How-To for Android].
